dalserver.scs

Class ScsServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • HttpServlet
      • dalserver.scs.ScsServlet

  • public class ScsServlet
extends HttpServlet
    Generic HTTP Servlet for the Simple Cone Search (SCS) protocol.

    This is a generic HTTP servlet which implements an SCS service using the service implementation provided by the generic ScsService class. This implements the SCS protocol includng all input parameters plus some DALServer specific custom parameters (e.g. FORMAT) as well as SCS-specific methods, e.g., for generating the output table. This base implementation of SCS provides both a working cone search service using a builtin copy of the 110-row Messier catalog, as well as a base class which can be subclassed to generate custom services.

    To turn this into a customized SCS service, one could 1) subclass ScsService and modify it as necessary to query a real data collection, and 2) subclass this class (ScsServlet) and override the newScsService method to call the custom ScsService class provided in step 1). The modified Servlet class should then be runnable in any compliant Java application server such as Apache Tomcat.

    This implementation of SCS also provides a capability to automatically provide an SCS interface for any external database table for which a JDBC interface is available. Parameters in the servlet "web.xml" file are used to define the JDBC endpoint and driver, database and table to be queried, and the table fields to be used for RA and DEC.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String dbName
      The name of the database to be accessed.
      protected java.lang.String dbPassword
      The password to be used to login to the DBMS.
      protected java.lang.String dbType
      The type of database to be accessed, e.g., "MySQL", "PostgreSQL", or "builtin".
      protected java.lang.String dbUser
      The user name to be used to login to the DBMS.
      protected java.lang.String jdbcDriver
      The address of the JDBC driver to be used, e.g., "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver".
      protected java.lang.String jdbcUrl
      The JDBC URL of the database server, e.g., "jdbc:mysql://:3306/".
      protected java.lang.String serviceClass
      The DAL service class to which the service instance belongs, e.g., SCS, SIAP, SSAP.
      protected java.lang.String serviceName
      The name of the service or servlet instance.
      protected java.lang.String serviceVersion
      The default service interface version supported by the service if no version number is explicitly negotiated.
      protected java.lang.String tableName
      The name of the table to be accessed by the SCS service.

    • Field Detail

      • serviceName

        protected java.lang.String serviceName
        The name of the service or servlet instance. This is used to construct file names for service-specific configuration files. For example, if we have two different SCS service instances these should have distinct service names. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml). Optional.

      • serviceClass

        protected java.lang.String serviceClass
        The DAL service class to which the service instance belongs, e.g., SCS, SIAP, SSAP. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml). Optional.

      • serviceVersion

        protected java.lang.String serviceVersion
        The default service interface version supported by the service if no version number is explicitly negotiated. This is usually the highest standard interface version supported by the service. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml).

      • dbType

        protected java.lang.String dbType
        The type of database to be accessed, e.g., "MySQL", "PostgreSQL", or "builtin". For the most part JDBC hides the difference between DBMS implementations, but not entirely.

      • dbName

        protected java.lang.String dbName
        The name of the database to be accessed. By "database" we mean a SQL catalog or schema containing tables.

      • tableName

        protected java.lang.String tableName
        The name of the table to be accessed by the SCS service.

      • jdbcUrl

        protected java.lang.String jdbcUrl
        The JDBC URL of the database server, e.g., "jdbc:mysql://:3306/".

      • jdbcDriver

        protected java.lang.String jdbcDriver
        The address of the JDBC driver to be used, e.g., "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver".

      • dbUser

        protected java.lang.String dbUser
        The user name to be used to login to the DBMS.

      • dbPassword

        protected java.lang.String dbPassword
        The password to be used to login to the DBMS. This should not be a real user password, but rather the password of a DBMS account used to provide low security, read-only access the database.

      • newScsService

        public ScsService newScsService(ScsParamSet params)
        Get a new ScsService instance. By default the generic dataless ScsService class is used. To build a real data service, subclass ScsServlet and replace the newScsService method with one which calls a custom replacement for the builtin generic ScsService class.
        Parameters:
        params - The input and service parameters.
